Test Description
Statewide election for the head of the Wisconsin Department of Public Instruction, responsible for overseeing public education across the state. This is a nonpartisan state-level office.

Statewide election for a seat on the Wisconsin Supreme Court (the state's highest court). The winner will serve a 10-year term as a Wisconsin Supreme Court Justice. The race is officially nonpartisan but carries significant ideological importance.

position: Milwaukee County Circuit Court Judge - Branch 6
description: Election for the judge of Branch 6 in the Milwaukee County Circuit Court. This is a nonpartisan local judicial position (six-year term) at the trial court level in Milwaukee County.

position: Milwaukee County Circuit Court Judge - Branch 11
description: Election for the judge of Branch 11 in the Milwaukee County Circuit Court. This nonpartisan local judicial race is for a six-year term on the Milwaukee County trial court.

position: Milwaukee County Circuit Court Judge - Branch 26
description: Election for the judge of Branch 26 in the Milwaukee County Circuit Court. This is a nonpartisan local judicial office on the Milwaukee County trial court, with a six-year term.

position: Milwaukee County Circuit Court Judge - Branch 36
description: Election for the judge of Branch 36 in the Milwaukee County Circuit Court. This nonpartisan local judicial position carries a six-year term on Milwaukee County's trial court.

position: Milwaukee County Circuit Court Judge - Branch 40
description: Election for the judge of Branch 40 in the Milwaukee County Circuit Court. This is a nonpartisan election for a six-year term on Milwaukee's county trial court.

position: Milwaukee County Circuit Court Judge - Branch 41
description: Election for the judge of Branch 41 in the Milwaukee County Circuit Court. This nonpartisan local judicial race will determine who serves a six-year term for Branch 41.
Election for the judge of Branch 1 in the Milwaukee Municipal Court. This city-level judicial position handles municipal ordinance cases; the race is nonpartisan and the term is four years.
The Mayor is the chief executive officer of the city, responsible for overseeing city departments, proposing the budget, appointing department heads, and representing the city.
Represents Ward 1 on the City Council, responsible for enacting ordinances, approving the city budget, and providing constituent services.

Members of the Board of Education are responsible for setting policy, overseeing district finances, adopting curriculum, and hiring the superintendent for the Mooreland Public Schools district.

Governs the local school district, setting policies, budget, and overseeing the superintendent. General elections are held if a primary was necessary and no candidate received over 50% of the vote, or if only two candidates filed.
Governs a statutory municipality, responsible for local ordinances, budget, and administration. This is the general election date for these positions.

Represents a specific ward on the Oklahoma City Council. A runoff election is held if no candidate received a majority in the February 11, 2025, general election. Ward 7 is confirmed to have a runoff.
Serves as the chief executive officer of the City of Norman. A runoff election is held if no candidate received a majority in the February 11, 2025, general election.
Represents a specific ward on the Norman City Council. A runoff election is held if no candidate received a majority in the February 11, 2025, general election for Wards 1, 3, 5, and 7.
Serves as the chief executive officer of the City of Edmond. This is the general election date.
Represents District 1 on the Oklahoma County Board of Commissioners. This is a special general election.
Represents District 71 in the Oklahoma House of Representatives. This is a special primary election to fill a vacancy.
Represents District 74 in the Oklahoma House of Representatives. This is a special primary election to fill a vacancy.

position: State Senator District 8 (Special Runoff Primary Election)
description: Represents District 8 in the Oklahoma State Senate. This is a special runoff primary election, if necessary, following the March 4, 2025 primary.

Represents District 50 (parts of Kershaw, Lee, and Sumter counties) in the South Carolina House of Representatives. Responsibilities include creating state laws and budgets. This is a primary election.
Serves on the Florence City Council, responsible for setting city policy, adopting budgets, and passing ordinances.
Chief executive officer of the City of Winnsboro, presides over council meetings, and represents the city.
Member of the Winnsboro City Council, responsible for setting city policy, adopting budgets, and passing ordinances.
Member of the Ware Shoals Town Council, responsible for setting town policy, adopting budgets, and passing ordinances. This is a special election.
Member of the Bennettsville City Council, responsible for setting city policy, adopting budgets, and passing ordinances. This is a special election.
